title: Vietnam accelerates island building to challenge China’s maritime claims
content: As tensions mount in the South China Sea, Vietnam is dredging and filling in land, fortifying barriers and erecting new structures to create hundreds of acres.
summary: As tensions mount in the South China Sea, Vietnam is dredging and filling in land, fortifying barriers and erecting new structures to create hundreds of acres.

title: South Korea recycles 98% of its food waste. What can it teach the world?
content: Almost all leftovers from homes and restaurants are turned into compost, animal feed and even energy. But its model isn’t easy to replicate.
summary: Almost all leftovers from homes and restaurants are turned into compost, animal feed and even energy. But its model isn’t easy to replicate.

title: Britain’s riots put spotlight on far-right misinformation
content: Social media posts — including a few by X owner Elon Musk — have played a crucial role in accelerating rage and misinformation.
summary: Social media posts — including a few by X owner Elon Musk — have played a crucial role in accelerating rage and misinformation.

title: U.S., Egypt, Qatar urge Israel, Hamas to restart Gaza cease-fire talks
content: Israel said it would send a delegation to the resumed negotiations, to be held in Cairo or Doha, Qatar. Hamas gave no immediate response.
summary: Israel said it would send a delegation to the resumed negotiations, to be held in Cairo or Doha, Qatar. Hamas gave no immediate response.

title: Ukraine, powered by Western arms, stuns Russia in cross-border assault
content: A surprise Ukrainian attack into Russia’s Kursk region appeared to use Western-donated fighting vehicles. The U.S. offered no objections to the operation.
summary: A surprise Ukrainian attack into Russia’s Kursk region appeared to use Western-donated fighting vehicles. The U.S. offered no objections to the operation.

title: Israel strikes Gaza schools, saying Hamas uses them to plan attacks
content: Israel targeted two schools in Gaza City on Thursday, killing at least 16 people, the civil defense force said.
summary: Israel targeted two schools in Gaza City on Thursday, killing at least 16 people, the civil defense force said.

title: Israel repelled Iran’s first direct attack. Is it ready for the next one?
content: There is apprehension in Israel about the strength of its regional anti-Tehran coalition and the ability of its air defense systems to repel a complex assault.
summary: There is apprehension in Israel about the strength of its regional anti-Tehran coalition and the ability of its air defense systems to repel a complex assault.

title: Catalan leader Puigdemont reemerges in Spain, then vanishes, evading arrest
content: Carles Puigdemont had been in self-imposed exile since a bid for Catalan independence in 2017. His return is a challenge to Spanish authorities.
summary: Carles Puigdemont had been in self-imposed exile since a bid for Catalan independence in 2017. His return is a challenge to Spanish authorities.

title: Maduro boasts 2,200 arrests since election; rights groups say 23 dead
content: The number of detainees has been too high for defense lawyers to keep up.
summary: The number of detainees has been too high for defense lawyers to keep up.

title: Taylor Swift cancels Vienna shows after two arrested on suspicion of plotting attack
content: Authorities found explosive devices and Islamic State propaganda in the home of one of the suspects, 19. Swift’s concerts were expected to draw more than 150,000 people.
summary: Authorities found explosive devices and Islamic State propaganda in the home of one of the suspects, 19. Swift’s concerts were expected to draw more than 150,000 people.

title: Banksy’s mysterious trail of animal-themed art delights and confuses London
content: The anonymous street artist Banksy has revealed four animal-themed murals in four days in London, with many speculating there could be more to come this week.
summary: The anonymous street artist Banksy has revealed four animal-themed murals in four days in London, with many speculating there could be more to come this week.

title: Japan issues first ‘megaquake’ warning for Nankai Trough after strong temblor
content: After a 7.1-magnitude quake, Japan’s meteorological agency said there is a higher chance of a major quake in the nearby trough that could trigger powerful tsunamis.
summary: After a 7.1-magnitude quake, Japan’s meteorological agency said there is a higher chance of a major quake in the nearby trough that could trigger powerful tsunamis.

title: After a week of U.K. riots, thousands fill the streets to decry racism
content: For the most part, the counterdemonstrators appeared to outnumber the agitators. And, for one night at least, they helped stop the violence.
summary: For the most part, the counterdemonstrators appeared to outnumber the agitators. And, for one night at least, they helped stop the violence.

title: As war looms and flights dwindle, Lebanese grapple with whether to flee
content: The exodus from Lebanon began last week after back-to-back assassinations targeted a Hezbollah commander near Beirut and Hamas leader Ismail Haniyeh in Tehran.
summary: The exodus from Lebanon began last week after back-to-back assassinations targeted a Hezbollah commander near Beirut and Hamas leader Ismail Haniyeh in Tehran.

title: Putin calls cross-border attack in Kursk region a ‘provocation’
content: The Russian president confirmed that Ukrainian forces had crossed the border into the Kursk region of western Russia.
summary: The Russian president confirmed that Ukrainian forces had crossed the border into the Kursk region of western Russia.

title: Thailand takes another backward step by banning main opposition party
content: On Aug. 7, Thailand’s constitutional court banned Pita Limjaroenrat — the country’s most popular politician — from holding office and dissolved his party.
summary: On Aug. 7, Thailand’s constitutional court banned Pita Limjaroenrat — the country’s most popular politician — from holding office and dissolved his party.

title: Man stole thousands of rare ‘Bluey’ coins worth $393,000, police say
content: The man, who was arrested, stole 63,000 Bluey coins, or “Dollarbucks,” from the back of a truck, Australian police said. Only a tiny proportion have been recovered.
summary: The man, who was arrested, stole 63,000 Bluey coins, or “Dollarbucks,” from the back of a truck, Australian police said. Only a tiny proportion have been recovered.

title: Ukraine counts on its Olympic athletes to demonstrate ‘the will to win’
content: High jumper Yaroslava Mahuchikh and fencer Olga Kharlan are among those in Paris trying to not just excel, but to lift up the nation and act as diplomats.
summary: High jumper Yaroslava Mahuchikh and fencer Olga Kharlan are among those in Paris trying to not just excel, but to lift up the nation and act as diplomats.

title: Who are Hamas’s top leaders? What to know about Yehiya Sinwar.
content: Sinwar, Hamas’s leader in Gaza and the mastermind of the Oct. 7 attack on Israel, will succeed Ismail Haniyeh as the new head of its political bureau.
summary: Sinwar, Hamas’s leader in Gaza and the mastermind of the Oct. 7 attack on Israel, will succeed Ismail Haniyeh as the new head of its political bureau.

title: The seductive Spanish village where the past feels present
content: Spanish picnics, Flamenco guitar and Andalusian horses make the past feel present on the dusty road to El Rocío.
summary: Spanish picnics, Flamenco guitar and Andalusian horses make the past feel present on the dusty road to El Rocío.

title: Walz has a long history with China. But he’s not ‘pro-China.’
content: Vice President Harris’s running mate taught in China in 1989, sparking an enduring interest in the country but also leading him to criticize its human rights abuses.
summary: Vice President Harris’s running mate taught in China in 1989, sparking an enduring interest in the country but also leading him to criticize its human rights abuses.
